definition: one of a sequence of contests (or subdivisions of a contest) between the same two opponents/round (boxing etc)/rally (tennis etc)/frame (billiards etc)/inning/(tennis, soccer etc) rubber or leg/round (of negotiations)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
Doha Round (world trade talks that began in Doha, Qatar in 2001)

sentences.english: The young boxer has copped the prize of the first round.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的拳击手已获得了第一回合的胜利。

sentences.english: China joined into WTO, accompanying with the processes of Duha Round.
sentences.chinese: 中国加入WTO，同时也伴随着多哈回合的历程。

sentences.english: Play is turn-based, with Red starting.
sentences.chinese: 游戏是回合制，以红色开始。

sentences.english: Return it to play under its owner's control at end of turn. It's so tough it can frighten itself into hiding. Illus.
sentences.chinese: 在回合结束时将它在其拥有者的操控下移回场上。

sentences.english: That was the most anybody has ever landed on Pacquiao in a single round.
sentences.chinese: 这是大部分拳手在一个回合里打在帕奎奥身上的拳数。

sentences.english: The defending champoin won the first set, but the challenger took the second.
sentences.chinese: 擂主赢了第一回合，但是第二回合是挑战者获胜。

sentences.english: The defending champoin won the first set, but the challenger took the second.
sentences.chinese: 擂主赢了第一回合，但是第二回合是挑战者获胜。

sentences.english: Tyson had repeatedly complained about head-butting in the first bout between the two.
sentences.chinese: 第一回合中，泰森在不断抱怨两人之间的头部撞击。

sentences.english: The Duha Round is a new round of WTO multi-trade negotiation rounds.
sentences.chinese: 多哈回合是WTO的新一轮多边贸易谈判回合。

sentences.english: The Duha Round is a new round of WTO multi-trade negotiation rounds.
sentences.chinese: 多哈回合是WTO的新一轮多边贸易谈判回合。

sentences.english: The champion dropped the challenger in the fourth round.
sentences.chinese: 这位冠军在第四回合把挑战者击倒在地。

sentences.english: There are three rounds in an amateur boxing bout.
sentences.chinese: 一场业余拳击比赛打三个回合。

sentences.english: The Referee and Judges of a kumite bout must not have the nationality of either of the participants.
sentences.chinese: 对打回合赛的主审和副审或与参赛者不可有相同国籍。

sentences.english: That mill in turn will cut the trees into smaller pieces known as "cants".
sentences.chinese: 该回合磨将削减坎茨“作为”之称的树木成小块。

sentences.english: In the middle of the room was the grand piano with two round stools.
sentences.chinese: 在房间的中央中是有二个回合凳子的大钢琴。

sentences.english: The other boxer put Jim out in the third round.
sentences.chinese: 第三个回合拳击手将吉姆打昏了。

definition: unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
to batter/combo (hit) (gaming)/(volleyball, table tennis etc) double hit/double contact
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
